value.title: Power BI Get Data: Import vs. DirectQuery vs. Live (2021)
value.excerpt: Import vs. DirectQuery vs. Live connection. Which do you choose and why in Power BI? Adam looks at the three options when creating reports in Power BI Desktop including composite models.  Power BI Data Sources: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/connect-data/power-bi-data-sources  Star Schema: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/star-schema

value.title: Five Essential Power Tools for Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: The External Tools ribbon is a feature that has been available in Power BI Desktop since the July 2020 release.Â  This feature should be considered essential to anyone who is regularly working in the Power BI space.Â  Â  In this article I recommend my top five External Tools, that I [...]Read More Â»

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day
value.excerpt: The Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day online course aims to empower you as a report author with the technical knowledge required to create, publish, and distribute Power BI paginated reports. We recommend you watch the videos in the recorded sequence, starting with video 1 and ending with video 24.

topItems.title: Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day - 01: Welcome and Course Introduction
topItems.excerpt: In this video, Peter Myers (Microsoft Most Valued Professional - Data Platform, and course developer), Chris Finlan (Principal Program Manager), and special guest Paginated Report Bear (Course Morale Manager) welcome and introduce you to the course, its outline and the course demo scenario.  The Power

value.title: Vaccination Tracker Part1: Get data from github and schedule refresh it
value.excerpt: This video is part 1 of the upcoming series: How to create a Vaccine tracker.  In Part 1 we will get the data from Github, publish it to a PPU workspace (we will need that later) and show you how to schedule refresh it and what to do if the option is not available.  To get the files go to Curbal Download

value.title: Get data with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: How can you find, collect, and clean data from different sources? Power BI is a tool for making sense of your data. You will learn tricks to make data-gathering easier.

value.title: 5 IDEAS to take Power BI reports to the NEXT LEVEL
value.excerpt: Struggling with making good Power BI reports? Adam has 5 ideas to help you take your reports to the NEXT LEVEL! You don't have to be a graphic artist to get there either! value.title: Exploring the Power Automate Visual in Power BI | Sending emails
value.excerpt: Using Power Automate? Using Power BI? Why not put the two together for some interesting scenarios. Patrick uses the Power Automate visual, in a Power BI report, to send emails out.  Power Automate: https://flow.microsoft.com/  Blog Announcement: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/announcing-the-new-power-automate-visual-for-power-bi-reports/

value.title: Power BI Bookmarks, Selections and Toggles
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how you can use bookmarks and selections to create interesting reports to show different aspects of your data. He also shows a very cool way to change between those selections that he picked up from one of his customers.  Bookmarks - https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-desktop-bookmarks/

value.title: Power BI date table: create using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how to create a Power BI date table using DAX. The end result uses a combination of the GENERATE(), ROW() and CALENDARAUTO() DAX functions to create a calculated table resulting in a Power BI date table.  Using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS in DAX https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/using-generate-and-row-instead-of-addcolumns-in-dax/

value.title: Get and transform data with Power BI
value.excerpt: Get and transform data with Power BI

topItems.title: Get data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

topItems.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that youâ€™re seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Prepare data for analysis
value.excerpt: Students will explore Power Query as they learn to extract data from different data sources and choose a storage mode and connectivity type. They will learn to profile, clean, and load data into Power BI in preparation for modeling their data.

value.title: 2 ways to reduce your Power BI dataset size and speed up refresh
value.excerpt: Adam shows you two things to reduce your Power BI dataset size. These are both things he commonly sees with Power BI reports and could potentially save you a lot of space and improve refresh times along with report performance.  Data reduction techniques for import modeling: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/import-modeling-data-reduction

value.title: Getting started with Power BI Paginated Reports (2021)
value.excerpt: Not sure what Power BI Paginated Reports are or how to use them? Patrick walks you through and points you to some great resources to get up and running quickly.  Power BI Paginated Reports require either Power BI Premium Per User or Power BI Premium capacity.  Paginated Report In a Day: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/learning-catalog/paginated-reports-online-course

value.title: Power BI Tutorial | From Flat File To Data Model
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Patrick looks at how to load data from a flat file to the data model. This could be a text, csv or excel file with a lot of columns. Don't just pull it into Power BI. Take time to structure your data in your data model. From flat file to data model is basic concept, but is

REDUCE Power BI dataset size by 60% with ONE CHECKBOX??? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RnDdDlozcdo  Bravo

value.title: Power BI Slicers vs Filters - which will you choose?
value.excerpt: Adam picks up on David Eldersveld's blog about Power BI slicers versus filters and looks at if slicers are even needed now. The filter pane can satisfy a majority of scenarios. There are a few that it can't. Which Power BI feature will you choose?  David Eldersveld blog - https://dataveld.com/2019/01/18/are-power-bi-slicers-still-relevant-with-the-new-filter-pane/
